June 9, 1952
Commissioner Edward M. Webster
federal Communications Commission
ashington 25, D. C.
Dear Commissioner Webster:
I was among those present when you discussed
broadcasting to foreign countries at the Columbus
Institute, so it was only natural that in writing up
the Institute for the flAED flews-ter I should make
reference to your talk.
Fortunately the Institute's publicity department
had send me a news release based upon your manuscript
from which to work in shaping a story about your
presentation.
Although you should be on the mailing list for
our publication I am enclosing a copy of the May issue,
on page 7 of which is the story relative to your talk.
fours sincerely.
Burton Paulu
